H0.text: Filter the salt is the best way to separate the salt from the water in an experiment where water and salt are mixed together.

H1.text: Freeze the mixture is the best way to separate the salt from the water in an experiment where water and salt are mixed together.

H2.text: Evaporating the water is the best method for separating salt from the water in an experiment where the two are mixed together.

H3.text: Pouring the water out of the container is the best way to separate the salt from the water in an experiment where water and salt are mixed together.

A4.text: The use of evaporation to dry or concentrate samples is a common preparatory step for many laboratory analyses such as spectroscopy and chromatography.

A5.text: Industrial applications include many printing and coating processes; recovering salts from solutions; and drying a variety of materials such as lumber, paper, cloth and chemicals.
